name: Xisal_285108_Var02_r03_d08_a00_b03
description:
Xisal combines three separate periodic formulae, mappping each one onto a dot-matrix grid with separate ranges and offsets. Noise is taken from circular motion on a 2D noise field with its own radius and offset. These values are mapped onto a range of colours according to one of seven different algorithms, and rotation is added to produce interference patterns with a choice from eight rendering modes.
The initial seed for this loop of 300 frames is 285108, which selects function 0 with offset (-65.0, -23.0), range (-7.0, -3.0), and function 3 with offset (-35.0, -5.0), range (-2.8000011, -7.0). Noise is produced from sampling points on an ellipse at co-ordinates (-57.0, 19.0) with diameters (7.0, 1.0). The three formulae are combined using algorithm 4 with hue values starting at 168 with range 325. The grid is 181 units square.
